ch.epfl.alpano.dem

Interface DiscreteElevationModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HgtDiscreteElevationModel

    public interface DiscreteElevationModel
    A DiscreteElevationModel is a model that has information about elevations at discrete points. These points will be called index's. This model only contains the elevation at hole indexes. An Index is a second of a degree. For elevation at floating point values see ContinuousElevationModel.
    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SAMPLES_PER_DEGREE
      Represents the number of sample per degrees of a MNT discrete.
      static double SAMPLES_PER_RADIAN
      Represents the number of sample per radian of a MNT discrete.

        Converts an angle into it's index.

      • elevationSample

        double elevationSample(int x,
                       int y)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gives the elevation of a point using his coordinate x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - The index on the x-axis.
        y - The index of the y-axis.
        Returns:
        The altitude of the given index. Altitude is given in meters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given indexes are outside of the range of the MNT.

      • union

        default DiscreteElevationModel union(DiscreteElevationModel that)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an union that represents a discrete MNT.
        Parameters:
        that - The discreteElevation that you want to make the union with.
        Returns:
        The discrete MNT that represents the union of the two extend.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If you can not make an union of the two extends.
